basics.name: Kevin Westropp
basics.label: Software Engineering Team Lead at Tipico
basics.summary: Experienced software engineer and front-end developer with a proven track record in leading teams, coordinating projects, mentoring developers, and enhancing user experiences. Proficient in various technologies including React, Vue.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and TypeScript. Holds a Master's degree in Computer Science and has a strong commitment to delivering high-quality code and optimizing performance. Also actively involved in volunteer work, mentoring students and contributing to environmental initiatives.
basics.headline: Developer

work.name: Tipico
work.summary:
Tools & Technology: React, Redux, Typescript, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, EJS, Mixpanel, GTM, Docker, Kubernetes
Responsibilities & Achievements:
- Leading UX Development team for main sportsbook application
- Coordinating project requirements with stakeholders, product owners, developers, designers and analysts
- Mentoring other developers in expanding programming skills and methodologies
- Building out new UX designs that elevate the User Experience across sportsbook and related applications (i.e. portal & casino)
- Reviewing front end designs and code development to ensure quality standards
- Partnering with Quality Assurance Engineers to expand the robustness of the testing suite of tools and ensure regressions are consistent and include minimal issues for customers
- Working with the Infrastructure team to enhance the CICD pipeline
- Consulting on engineering hiring process to improve talent acquisition
- Working on team capacity planning with Product Management
- Performance monitoring and investigating performance degradation

volunteer.summary: ECSS connects high school, college, and the world of work through dynamic partnerships and pioneers a new vision for college and career readiness. With a unique 9-14 model, students will receive an associate's degree a six year time frame. CPS, the City Colleges and our corporate sponsors will work together to ensure that students have an opportunity to pursue a career in technology and gain skills for the 21st century workforce, enabling them to realize their full potential.

A private not-for-profit corporation and land trust that supports land preservation and conservation through educational and community programs and events.

http://www.lfola.org/getinvolved/teachaclass.aspx
